results.headline: S&P 500 Rebound Leaves Big Banks Out on Earnings: Markets Wrap
results.summary: The stock market saw another week of gains and Treasuries erased their losses for the year after the latest economic data reinforced bets the Federal Reserve will cut rates in September.

results.headline: General Catalyst, Amazon Bet $63M on AI Robotics Startup
results.summary: AI robotics startup Standard Bots has raised $63 million over a series of deals. A majority of that funding haul, which has not been previously reported, comes from a $39 million Series B round led by General Catalyst with participation from the Amazon Industrial Innovation Fund and Samsung Next. Standard Bots CEO Evan Beard joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Technology." (Source: Bloomberg)

results.headline: General Catalyst, Amazon Back AI-Powered Robotics Startup
results.summary: Artificial intelligence robotics startup Standard Bots has raised $63 million over a series of deals, the company plans to announce Friday.

results.headline: TSMC’s Second Quarter Results May Fuel Its $420 Billion Rally as AI Demand Soars
results.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s $420 billion equity rally this year will get a valuation test next week when it reports earnings, with analysts expecting the chipmaker to raise full-year sales forecasts.

results.authors: By Sohee Kim and Shery Ahn
results.headline: Samsung Union Targets Highest-End AI Chip Plants as Strike Flags
results.summary: Samsung Electronics Co.’s largest union is now calling on employees at one of the company’s most advanced AI memory chip plants to walk off the job, switching tactics after their campaign for higher pay showed signs of losing steam.

results.headline: Union Boss Talks About Samsung Strike That Aims to Disrupt Global Chip Supply
results.summary: The leader of the Samsung Electronics Co. labor group that is the biggest union in the South Korean IT industry, says their move to "indefinitely" go on strike is already disrupting key production lines, rejecting the company's claims. Samsung says it is currently producing as planned, even as it grapples with the biggest organized labor protests in its half-century history. Son Woo-mok of the National Samsung Electronics Union speaks to Bloomberg Television's Shery Ahn. (Source: Bloomberg)

results.headline: Big Tech’s Climate Goals At Risk From Massive AI Energy Demands
results.summary: Microsoft, Google and Amazon are grappling with growing energy demands from artificial intelligence.

results.headline: Samsung’s Mobile Chief Pushes Company Past the Boring Old Phone Slab
results.summary: Samsung chose the heart of Paris as the venue to unveil its latest, greatest and probably most expensive gadget lineup to date. But first...

results.headline: Supply Chain Latest: Automating Supplier Deals in Logistics
results.summary: Pactum AI, a Silicon Valley-based software developer, has raised $20 million in venture capital from a consortium of backers, including Danish shipping giant Maersk, that’s betting on a future where many supplier deals are negotiated without humans.

results.authors: By Samuel Stolton and Jennifer Surane
results.headline: Apple Avoids EU Antitrust Threat With Tap-and-Pay Probe Settlement
results.summary: Apple Inc. has avoided the threat of fines from European Union regulators by agreeing to open up its mobile wallet technology to other providers free of charge for a decade.
